Problem:
Consider a linear transformation of a vector function \\( z(x) \\) described by the integral transformation \\( Z(s) = \\int_{0}^{\\infty} e^{-sx}z(x)dx \\), commonly known as the Laplace Transform. We examine the impact of pre-multiplying the vector \\( z(x) \\) by a constant matrix Q before applying the Laplace Transform.

Given the transformed function \\( Z_Q(s) \\) resulting from a Q-modified \\( z(x) \\), can we determine the original function \\( z(x) \\) without knowing matrix Q?
Explanation: The information about the matrix Q, which was used to modify \\( z(x) \\) before applying the Laplace Transform, is crucial. Without knowing Q, it is impossible to reverse the modifications accurately, as \\( Z_Q(s) \\) depends linearly on the modified \\( z(x) \\).
